intro: Trichipteris borinquena, commonly known as the Puerto Rican fern, is a rare and endemic species native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Trichipteris borinquena is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
